content.body: Inquisition and the Compromise of Nobles

prompt.body: Make combination between age-name and aspect. Use page 166-167.

content.body: The Dutch Revolt and the birth of an indepenent Dutch states

prompt.body: combine the age-names with the right years.

content.body:
Complete the text below:

During the , the seventeen Low Countries - 'gewesten' in dutch- were far from the united whole they are today. Every had his own laws and even their own currency. The only time they would come together was when they had each sent to the States-General. This was first created in 1386 with the direct goal of gathering more money. However, under Charles V these meetings only were arranged when he called them together, which happened. The provinces and their were very pleased with their personal control and power.

Charles V had different opinions about personal control and power. All that power and control had to be brought to in the Low Countries and put firmly in Charles's hands. We call this . He chose Brussels as his . Here he appointed a to rule in his name. He mainly did this to have more control over his so he could ask more .

In this painting (an unwritten and primary) source one sees Charles V, he (to appoint) his successors. His brother, who is standing (to stand) on his left will receive a part. Also Charles' son Philips on te right (to become) a powerful man. The ladies in front of Philip II, who (to kneel) and (to carry) flags, show us the seize of the Spanish Empire. Besides, all known continents like Europe, Asia, Africa and the Americas (to bring) gifts to Charles V. On the left Neptunes (to arrive) in a chariot pulled by seahorses. This Greek god of the Oceans (to hand) over a globe, which (to symbolize) the world. In his chariot there are also two classical pillars (or columns) and the Latin words Plus Ultra, which means 'Always more'.

Complete the list below. Remember, use the right order (present tense, past tense and past participle) Do not use capitals!

to step - stepped -

to leave - - left

to send - sent -

to bring - - brought

to appoint - appointed -

to put - - put

to know - - known

questions.label: (Grammar) Present, past tense and past participle

content.body:
Complete the lines, use the present continuous.

The duke of Alba (to sit) at the throne on the left. Behind him a devil (to carry) two crowns: one stands for the king, the other for the Church. His advisors, the Blood Council, (to stand) left of him. The cardinal in red (to blow) bad ideas in Alba's ear. Alba (to hold) a chain connected with the seventeen provinces. The provinces are portrayed as ladies who (to kneel) for him. They will have to obey Alba. On the right, the men in black (to represent) by the men in black. They (to hold) a finger to their lips, they have to keep silent. On the floor in front of them you can see the privileges.

At the background on the left, the Inquisition (to torture) prisoners. In the middle there are two scaffolds covered in black carpets. An executioner (to behead) Egmont and Horne, both opposed Phillips II. In the red pont, Margeretha of Parma (to fish) for propeties of wealthy convicted persons. At the right one can see Spanish soldiers who (to kill) protestants heretics.
